body:
Comment 1: 
I don't believe it makes sense for every hash implementation
to be required to supply the same code.  Also, printing a 
byte array in hexadecimal is a much more general operation;
why should it be constrained to hash functions?

s := fmt.Sprintf("%x", hash.Sum())

has the added benefit that it works even outside of the
hash implementations.
_Owner changed to **r...@golang.org**._ _Status changed to **WorkingAsIntended**._
